intro: Paepalanthus triangularis, commonly known as the triangular puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
